\/dev1234\/stats\/physical\/fanspeed.Description: Speed of the internal cooling fan.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/adcselect.Description: Selects the input signal for the demodulator.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/order.Description: Selects the filter roll off between 6 dB/oct and 48 dB/oct.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/rate.Description: Defines the demodulator sampling rate, the number of samples that are sent to the host computer per second. A rate of about 7-10 higher as compared to the filter bandwidth usually provides sufficient aliasing suppression. This is also the rate of data received by LabOne Data Server and saved to the computer hard disk. This setting has no impact on the sample rate on the auxiliary outputs connectors. Note: the value inserted by the user may be approximated to the nearest value supported by the instrument.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/oscselect.Description: Connects the demodulator with the supplied oscillator. Number of available oscillators depends on the installed options.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/harmonic.Description: Multiplies the demodulator's reference frequency by an integer factor. If the demodulator is used as a phase detector in external reference mode (PLL), the effect is that the internal oscillator locks to the external frequency divided by the integer factor.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/phaseshift.Description: Phase shift applied to the reference input of the demodulator.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/sinc.Description: Enables the sinc filter. When the filter bandwidth is comparable to or larger than the demodulation frequency, the demodulator output may contain frequency components at the frequency of demodulation and its higher harmonics. The sinc is an additional filter that attenuates these unwanted components in the demodulator output.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/bypass.Description: Allows to bypass the demodulator low-pass filter, thus increasing the bandwidth.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/timeconstant.Description: Sets the integration time constant or in other words, the cutoff frequency of the demodulator low pass filter.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/enable.Description: Enables the data acquisition for the corresponding demodulator. Note: increasing number of active demodulators increases load on the physical connection to the host computer.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/freq.Description: Indicates the frequency used for demodulation and for output generation. The demodulation frequency is calculated with oscillator frequency times the harmonic factor. When the MOD option is used linear combinations of oscillator frequencies including the harmonic factors define the demodulation frequencies.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/trigger.Description: Selects the acquisition mode (i.e. triggering) or the demodulator.

Options.0: "continuous": Continuous: demodulator data is continuously streamed to the host computer.
Options.3: "trigin2_both", "trigger_input2_both": Trigger Input 3: triggering on both rising and falling edge.
Options.5: "trigin2or3_rising", "trigger_input2or3_rising": Trigger Input 3 or 4: rising edge triggered on either input.
Options.10: "trigin2or3_falling", "trigger_input2or3_falling": Trigger Input 3 or 4: falling edge triggered on either input.
Options.12: "trigin3_both", "trigger_input3_both": Trigger Input 4: triggering on both rising and falling edge.
Options.15: "trigin2or3_both", "trigger_input2or3_both": Trigger Input 3 or 4: triggering on both rising and falling edge or either trigger input.
Options.16: "trigin2_low", "trigger_input2_low": Trigger Input 3: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is low (TTL).
Options.32: Trigger Input 3: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is high (TTL).
Options.64: "trigin3_low", "trigger_input3_low": Trigger Input 4: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is low (TTL).
Options.80: "trigin2or3_low", "trigger_input2or3_low": Trigger Input 3 or 4: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when either level is low (TTL).
Options.128: Trigger Input 4: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is high (TTL).
Options.160: "trigin2or3_high", "trigger_input2or3_high": Trigger Input 3 or 4: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when either level is high (TTL).
Options.1048576: "trigin0_rising", "trigger_input0_rising": Trigger Input 1: rising edge triggered. Requires an installed AWG option.
Options.2097152: "trigin1_rising", "trigger_input1_rising": Trigger Input 2: rising edge triggered. Requires an installed AWG option.
Options.4194304: "trigin2_rising", "trigger_input2_rising": Trigger Input 3: rising edge triggered. Requires an installed AWG option.
Options.8388608: "trigin3_rising", "trigger_input3_rising": Trigger Input 4: rising edge triggered. Requires an installed AWG option.
Options.16777216: "trigin0_high", "trigger_input0_high": Trigger Input 1: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is high. Requires an installed AWG option.
Options.33554432: "trigin1_high", "trigger_input1_high": Trigger Input 2: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is high. Requires an installed AWG option.
Options.67108864: "trigin2_high", "trigger_input2_high": Trigger Input 3: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is high. Requires an installed AWG option.
Options.134217728: "trigin3_high", "trigger_input3_high": Trigger Input 4: demodulator data is streamed to the host computer when the level is high. Requires an installed AWG option.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/phaseadjust.Description: Adjust the demodulator phase automatically in order to read 0 degrees.

\/dev1234\/extrefs\/0\/automode.Description: This defines the type of automatic adaptation of parameters in the PID used for Ext Ref.

Options.1: "coefficients_only": The coefficients of the PID controller are automatically set.
Options.2: "low_bandwidth": The PID coefficients, the filter bandwidth and the output limits are automatically set using a low bandwidth.
Options.3: "high_bandwidth": The PID coefficients, the filter bandwidth and the output limits are automatically set using a high bandwidth.
Options.4: "all": All parameters of the PID including the center frequency are adapted.

\/dev1234\/extrefs\/0\/adcselect.Description: Indicates the input signal selection for the selected demodulator.

Options.0: "sigin0", "signal_input0": Signal Input 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.1: "sigin1", "signal_input1": Signal Input 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.2: "trigin0", "trigger_input0": Trigger Input 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.3: "trigin1", "trigger_input1": Trigger Input 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.4: "auxout0", "auxiliary_output0": Auxiliary Output 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.5: "auxout1", "auxiliary_output1": Auxiliary Output 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.6: "auxout2", "auxiliary_output2": Auxiliary Output 3 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.7: "auxout3", "auxiliary_output3": Auxiliary Output 4 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.8: "auxin0", "auxiliary_input0": Auxiliary Input 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.9: "auxin1", "auxiliary_input1": Auxiliary Input 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.10: "demod3": Oscillator Phase of Demod 4 is connected to the corresponding demodulator. This selection combined with the demodulator's ExtRef Mode can be used to phase-lock two internal oscillators.
Options.11: "demod7": Oscillator Phase of Demod 8 is connected to the corresponding demodulator. This selection combined with the demodulator's ExtRef Mode can be used to phase-lock two internal oscillators.

\/dev1234\/extrefs\/0\/demodselect.Description: Indicates the demodulator connected to the extref channel.

\/dev1234\/extrefs\/0\/oscselect.Description: Indicates which oscillator is being locked to the external reference.

\/dev1234\/extrefs\/0\/locked.Description: Indicates whether the external reference is locked.

\/dev1234\/triggers\/in\/0\/imp50.Description: Trigger input impedance: When on, the trigger input impedance is 50 Ohm, when off 1 k Ohm.

\/dev1234\/triggers\/in\/0\/level.Description: Trigger voltage level at which the trigger input toggles between low and high. Use 50% amplitude for digital input and consider the trigger hysteresis.

\/dev1234\/triggers\/in\/0\/autothreshol.Description: Automatically adjust the trigger threshold. The level is adjusted to fall in the center of the applied transitions.

\/dev1234\/triggers\/out\/0\/source.Description: Select the signal assigned to the trigger output.

Options.1: "demod3_phase": Oscillator phase of demod 4 (trigger output channel 1) or demod 8 (trigger output channel 2). Trigger event is output for each zero crossing of the oscillator phase.
Options.2: "scope_trigger": Scope Trigger. Requires the DIG Option.
Options.4: "scope_armed": Scope Armed. Requires the DIG Option.
Options.6: "scope_active": Scope Active. Requires the DIG Option.
Options.8: "awg_marker0": AWG Marker 1. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.9: "awg_marker1": AWG Marker 2. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.10: "awg_marker2": AWG Marker 3. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.11: "awg_marker3": AWG Marker 4. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.20: "awg_active": AWG Active. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.21: "awg_waiting": AWG Waiting. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.22: "awg_fetching": AWG Fetching. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.23: "awg_playing": AWG Playing. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.32: "awg_trigger0": AWG Trigger 1. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.33: "awg_trigger1": AWG Trigger 2. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.34: "awg_trigger2": AWG Trigger 3. Requires the AWG Option.
Options.35: "awg_trigger3": AWG Trigger 4. Requires the AWG Option.

\/dev1234\/triggers\/out\/0\/drive.Description: When on, the bidirectional trigger on the front panel is in output mode. When off, the trigger is in input mode.

\/dev1234\/triggers\/out\/0\/pulsewidth.Description: Defines the minimal pulse width for the case of Scope and AWG Trigger/Active events written to the trigger outputs of the device.

\/dev1234\/triggers\/out\/0\/delay.Description: Trigger delay, controls the fine delay of the trigger output. The resolution is 78 ps.

\/dev1234\/status\/flags\/binary.Description: A set of binary flags giving an indication of the state of various parts of the device. Bit 0: Signal Input 1 overflow, Bit 1: Signal Input 2 overflow, Bit 2: Analog PLL fail, Bit 3: Output 1 DAC OK, Bit 4: Output 2 DAC OK, Bit 5: Signal Output 1 clipping, Bit 6: Signal Output 2 clipping, Bit 7: Ext Ref 1 Locked, Bit 8: Ext Ref 2 Locked, Bit 9:Ext Ref 3 Locked, Bit 10:Ext Ref 4 Locked, Bit 11: Sample Loss, Bits 12 - 13: Trigger In 1, Bits 14 - 15: Trigger In 2, Bits 16 - 17: Trigger In 3, Bits 18 - 19: Trigger In 4, Bit 20: PLL 1 locked, Bit 21: PLL 2 locked, Bit 22: PLL 3 locked, Bit 23: PLL 4 locked, Bit 24: Rubidium clock locked, Bit 25: AU Cartesian 1 Overflow, Bit 26: AU Cartesian 2 Overflow, Bit 27: AU Polar 1 Overflow, Bit 28: AU Polar 2 Overflow.

\/dev1234\/status\/adc0min.Description: The minimum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms

\/dev1234\/status\/adc0max.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 1 (ADC0) during 100 ms.

\/dev1234\/status\/adc1min.Description: The minimum value on Signal Input 2 (ADC1) during 100 ms

\/dev1234\/status\/adc1max.Description: The maximum value on Signal Input 2 (ADC1) during 100 ms.

\/dev1234\/stats\/physical\/overtemperat.Description: This flag is set to 1 if the temperature of the FPGA exceeds 85°C. It will be reset to 0 after a restart of the device.

\/dev1234\/dios\/0\/input.Description: Gives the value of the DIO input for those bytes where drive is disabled.

\/dev1234\/auxins\/0\/sample.Description: Voltage measured at the Auxiliary Input after averaging. The data rate depends on the averaging value. Note, if the instrument has demodulator functionality, the auxiliary input values are available as fields in a demodulator sample and are aligned by timestamp with the demodulator output.

Options.0: "internal": Internal 10 MHz clock is used as the frequency and time base reference.
Options.1: "external": An external 10 MHz clock is used as the frequency and time base reference. Provide a clean and stable 10 MHz reference to the appropriate back panel connector.

\/dev1234\/system\/fwlogenable.Description: Enables logging to the fwlog node.

\/dev1234\/system\/compdelay\/calibrate.Description: Perform automatic calibration of the input delay compensation.

\/dev1234\/system\/compdelay\/delays\/0.Description: Current values of the compensation delays. 0: Signal Input 0, 1: Signal Input 1, 2: Aux Inputs, 3: Trigger Inputs, 4: Loopbacks

\/dev1234\/system\/boardrevisions\/0.Description: Hardware revision of the FPGA base board

\/dev1234\/system\/powerconfigdate.Description: Contains the date of power configuration (format is: (year << 16) | (month << 8) | day)

Options.0: Device is warmed-up and self calibrated.
Options.1: It is recommended to manually execute a self calibration to assure operation according to specifications.
Options.2: Device is warming up and will automatically execute a self calibration after 16 minutes.

\/dev1234\/system\/calib\/timeinterval.Description: Time interval for which the self calibration is valid. After this time it is recommended to rerun the auto calibration.

\/dev1234\/system\/calib\/tempthreshold.Description: When the temperature changes by the specified amount, it is recommended to rerun the self calibration.

\/dev1234\/system\/calib\/auto.Description: Enables an automatic instrument self calibration about 16 min after start up. In order to guarantee the full specification, it is recommended to perform a self calibration after warm-up of the device.

\/dev1234\/system\/calib\/next.Description: Remaining seconds until the first calibration is executed or a recalibration is requested.

\/dev1234\/system\/calib\/calibrate.Description: Initiates self calibration to improve input digitizer linearity.

\/dev1234\/system\/xenpakenable.Description: Indicates whether the 10 gigabit ethernet option is installed and enabled.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/enable.Description: Enables the acquisition of scope shots.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/time.Description: Defines the time base of the scope from the divider exponent of the instrument's clock base. The resulting sampling time is 2^n/clockbase.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigenable.Description: When triggering is enabled scope data are acquired every time the defined trigger condition is met.

Options.1: "on": ON: Trigger based scope shot acquisition

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigrising.Description: When set (1), enables rising edge triggering. This settings is synchronized with the settings done in the /TRIGFALLING node.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigfalling.Description: When set (1), enables falling edge triggering. This settings is synchronized with the settings done in the /TRIGSLOPE node.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/length.Description: Defines the length of the recorded Scope shot in number of samples.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigholdoff.Description: Defines the time before the trigger is rearmed after a recording event.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigholdoffcount.Description: Defines the trigger event number that will trigger the next recording after a recording event. A value of '1' will start a recording for each trigger event.

Options.1: "number_of_events": Holdoff is defined as number of events.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/channels\/0\/bwlim.Description: Selects between sample decimation and sample averaging. Averaging avoids aliasing, but may conceal signal peaks.

Options.0: "on": On: Selects sample averaging for sample rates lower than the maximal available sampling rate.
Options.1: "off": OFF: Selects sample decimation for sample rates lower than the maximal available sampling rate.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/channels\/0\/fulls.Description: Indicates the full scale value of the scope channel.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/channels\/0\/offse.Description: Indicates the offset value of the scope channel.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/channels\/0\/limit.Description: Lower limit of the scope full scale range. For demodulator, PID, Boxcar, and AU signals the limit should be adjusted so that the signal covers the specified range to achieve optimal resolution.
Upper limit of the scope full scale range. For demodulator, PID, Boxcar, and AU signals the limit should be adjusted so that the signal covers the specified range to achieve optimal resolution.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/single.Description: Puts the Scope into single shot mode.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trighysteresis\/ab.Description: Defines the voltage the source signal must deviate from the trigger level before the trigger is rearmed again. Set to 0 to turn it off. The sign is defined by the Edge setting.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trighysteresis\/re.Description: Hysteresis relative to the adjusted full scale signal input range. A hysteresis value larger than 1 (100%) is allowed.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trighysteresis\/mo.Description: Selects the mode to define the hysteresis strength. The relative mode will work best over the full input range as long as the analog input signal does not suffer from excessive noise.

Options.1: "relative": Selects a hysteresis relative to the adjusted full scale signal input range.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigstate.Description: When 1, indicates that the trigger signal satifies the conditions of the trigger.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigslope.Description: Sets on which slope of the trigger signal the scope should trigger. This setting is synchronized with the settings done in the /TRIGFALLING and /TRIGRISING nodes.

Options.3: "both": Triggers on both the rising and falling edge.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/triggate\/enable.Description: If enabled the trigger will be gated by the trigger gating input signal. This feature requires the DIG option.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/triggate\/inputsel.Description: Select the signal source used for trigger gating if gating is enabled. This feature requires the DIG option.

Options.0: "trigin2_high", "trigger_input2_high": Only trigger if the Trigger Input 3 is at high level.
Options.1: "trigin2_low", "trigger_input2_low": Only trigger if the Trigger Input 3 is at low level.
Options.2: "trigin3_high", "trigger_input3_high": Only trigger if the Trigger Input 4 is at high level.
Options.3: "trigin3_low", "trigger_input3_low": Only trigger if the Trigger Input 4 is at low level.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/segments\/enable.Description: Enable segmented scope recording. This allows for full bandwidth recording of scope shots with a minimum dead time between individual shots. This functionality requires the DIG option.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/segments\/count.Description: Specifies the number of segments to be recorded in device memory. The maximum scope shot size is given by the available memory divided by the number of segments. This functionality requires the DIG option.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigreference.Description: Trigger reference position relative to the acquired data. Default is 50% (0.5) which results in a reference point in the middle of the acquired data.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/trigdelay.Description: Trigger position relative to reference. A positive delay results in less data being acquired before the trigger point, a negative delay results in more data being acquired before the trigger point.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/stream\/enables\/0.Description: Enable scope streaming for the specified channel. This allows for continuous recording of scope data on the plotter and streaming to disk. Note: scope streaming requires the DIG option.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/stream\/rate.Description: Streaming Rate of the scope channels. The streaming rate can be adjusted independent from the scope sampling rate. The maximum rate depends on the interface used for transfer. Note: scope streaming requires the DIG option.

\/dev1234\/scopes\/0\/stream\/sample.Description: Streaming node containing scope sample data. Note: scope streaming requires the DIG option.

\/dev1234\/dios\/0\/extclk.Description: Select DIO internal or external clocking.

Options.0: "internal": The DIO is internally clocked with a frequency of 56.25 MHz.
Options.1: "external": The DIO is externally clocked with a clock signal connected to DIO Pin 68. The available range is from 1 Hz up to the internal clock frequency.

\/dev1234\/dios\/0\/decimation.Description: Sets the decimation factor for DIO data streamed to the host computer.

Options.0: "manual": Enables manual control of the DIO output bits.
Options.1: "awg_sequencer_commands": Enables setting of DIO output values by AWG sequencer commands.

\/dev1234\/dios\/0\/drive.Description: When on (1), the corresponding 8-bit bus is in output mode. When off (0), it is in input mode. Bit 0 corresponds to the least significant byte. For example, the value 1 drives the least significant byte, the value 8 drives the most significant byte.

\/dev1234\/dios\/0\/output.Description: Sets the value of the DIO output for those bytes where 'drive' is enabled.

\/dev1234\/dios\/0\/auxdrive.Description: Not used. Reserved for future use.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/ac.Description: Defines the input coupling for the Signal Inputs. AC coupling inserts a high-pass filter.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/imp50.Description: Switches between 50 Ohm (ON) and 1 M Ohm (OFF).

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/bw.Description: Bandwidth of input aliasing filter at 600 MHz (ON) or 900 MHz (OFF) cut off frequency.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/range.Description: Defines the gain of the analog input amplifier. The range should exceed the incoming signal by roughly a factor two including a potential DC offset. The instrument selects the next higher available range relative to a value inserted by the user. A suitable choice of this setting optimizes the accuracy and signal-to-noise ratio by ensuring that the full dynamic range of the input ADC is used.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/min.Description: Indicates the minimum measured value at the input normalized to input range.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/max.Description: Indicates the maximum measured value at the input normalized to input range.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/diff.Description: Switch input mode between normal (OFF), inverted, and differential. The differential modes are implemented digitally and are not suited for analog common-mode rejection.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/autorange.Description: Automatic adjustment of the Range to about two times the maximum signal input amplitude measured over about 100 ms.

\/dev1234\/sigins\/0\/scaling.Description: Applies the given scaling factor to the input signal.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/imp50.Description: Select the load impedance between 50 Ohm and HiZ. The impedance of the output is always 50 Ohm. For a load impedance of 50 Ohm the displayed voltage is half the output voltage to reflect the voltage seen at the load.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/on.Description: Enabling/Disabling the Signal Output. Corresponds to the blue LED indicator on the instrument front panel.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/range.Description: Sets the output voltage range. The instrument selects the next higher available range.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/over.Description: Indicates that the signal output is overloaded.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/offset.Description: Defines the DC voltage that is added to the dynamic part of the output signal.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/enables\/0.Description: Enables individual output signal amplitude. When the MD option is used, it is possible to generate signals being the linear combination of the available demodulator frequencies.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/amplitudes\/0.Description: Sets the peak amplitude that the oscillator assigned to the given demodulation channel contributes to the signal output.

\/dev1234\/sigouts\/0\/autorange.Description: If enabled, selects the most suited output range automatically.

\/dev1234\/auxins\/0\/averaging.Description: Defines the number of samples on the input to average as a power of two. Possible values are in the range [0, 16]. A value of 0 corresponds to the sampling rate of the auxiliary input's ADC.

\/dev1234\/auxins\/0\/values\/0.Description: Voltage measured at the Auxiliary Input after averaging. The value of this node is updated at a low rate (50 Hz); the streaming node auxins/n/sample is updated at a high rate defined by the averaging.

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/mode.Description: Enabling of the first sideband and selection of the position of the sideband relative to the carrier frequency for manual mode.

Options.0: "off": Off: First sideband is disabled. The sideband demodulator behaves like a normal demodulator.
Options.1: "upper": C + M: First sideband to the right of the carrier
Options.2: "lower": C - M: First sideband to the left of the carrier

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/freqdevenable.Description: In FM mode, choose to work with either modulation index or peak deviation. The modulation index equals peak deviation divided by modulation frequency.

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/index.Description: FM modulation index: The modulation index equals peak deviation divided by modulation frequency.

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/carrier\/inputselect.Description: Select Signal Input for the carrier demodulation

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/inputs.Description: Select Signal Input for the sideband demodulation

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/carrier\/order.Description: Filter order used for carrier demodulation

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/order.Description: Filter order used for sideband demodulation

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/carrier\/timeconstan.Description: Sets the integration time constant or in other words, the cutoff frequency of the low-pass filter for the carrier demodulation.

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/timeco.Description: Sets the integration time constant or in other words, the cutoff frequency of the low-pass filter for the sideband demodulation.

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/carrier\/oscselect.Description: Select the oscillator for the carrier signal.

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/oscsel.Description: Select the oscillator for the second sideband.

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/carrier\/harmonic.Description: Set the harmonic of the carrier frequency. 1 = Fundamental

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/harmon.Description: Set harmonic of the sideband frequencies. 1 = fundamental

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/carrier\/phaseshift.Description: Phase shift applied to the reference input of the carrier demodulator and also to the carrier signal on the Signal Outputs

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/phases.Description: Phase shift applied to the reference input of the sideband demodulator and also to the sideband signal on the Signal Outputs

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/enable.Description: Enable the signal generation for the respective sideband

\/dev1234\/mods\/0\/sidebands\/0\/amplit.Description: Set the amplitude of the sideband components.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/periods.Description: Number of periods to average. This setting has no effect on Output PWAs.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/windowstart.Description: Boxcar averaging gate opening start in degrees. It can be converted to time assuming 360 equals to a full period of the driving oscillator.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/rate.Description: Current data transfer rate to the PC given by min(14 MSa/s , Frequency / max(1, Averaging Periods/512)). This value is read-only.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/overflow.Description: Overflow detected. The boxcar output may not be reliable any more. Sticky flag cleared by restarting the boxcar.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/inputselect.Description: Select Signal Input used for the boxcar analysis.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/oscselect.Description: Selection of the oscillator used for the boxcar analysis.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/decimation.Description: Indicates, in powers of 2, the number of averager outputs sent to the PC while Averaging Periods Boxcar integrations are obtained. Positive integer values indicate oversampling. Negative integer values indicate undersampling. Examples for oversampling values: 0 : 2^0 = 1 averager output is sent to the PC during Averaging Periods Boxcar integrations. 2 : 2^2 = 4 averager outputs are sent to the PC during Averaging Periods Boxcar integrations. -1 : 2^-1 = 0.5, only every other Averaging Periods Boxcar integrations an averager output is sent to the PC.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/freqoverflow.Description: Frequency for the boxcar is above or equal 450 MHz. The boxcar output may not be reliable any more. Sticky flag cleared by restarting the boxcar.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/fifooverflow.Description: Data lost during streaming to PC. Sticky flag cleared by restarting the boxcar.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/limitrate.Description: Rate Limit for Boxcar output data sent to PC. This value does not affect the Aux Output for which the effective rate is given by min(14 MSa/s , Frequency / max(1, Averaging Periods/512)).

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/baseline\/windows.Description: Boxcar baseline suppression gate opening start in degrees based on one oscillator frequency period equals 360 degrees.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/averagerbandwidth.Description: The 3 dB signal bandwidth of the Boxcar Averager is determined by the oscillation frequency and the Number of Averaging Periods set. Note: internally the boxcar signal is sampled at a rate of 14 MSa/s and the signal bandwidth of the auxiliary output is 7 MHz.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/windowsize.Description: Boxcar averaging gate opening width in seconds. It can be converted to phase assuming 360 equals to a full period of the driving oscillator.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/periodoverfloweve.Description: The boxcar averaging gate opening width is more than one cycle of the signal and should be reduced.

\/dev1234\/boxcars\/0\/sample.Description: Streaming node containing the output data of the boxcar.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/enable.Description: Enables the Output PWA for data acquisition. Depending on the value of the 'single' node, this may be continuous, or a one-shot acquisition.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/single.Description: If set to 1, a single data acquisition is executed when the Output PWA is enabled.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/oscselect.Description: Select reference oscillator for Output PWA signal acquisition.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/mode.Description: Sets the data interpretation mode. Measurement data can be interpreted in four different modes and displayed over either phase (native), time, frequency (FFT) or harmonics of the base frequency (FFT).

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/harmonic.Description: Defines the width of the PWA acquisition window in terms of harmonics of the selected reference oscillator frequency. e.g. A value of 1 corresponds to a complete cycle of the reference frequency. A value of 2 corresponds to half of a cycle (180 deg). A value of 4 corresponds to a quarter of a cycle (90 deg).

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/shift.Description: Defines the start of the Output PWA range in terms of the phase of the reference frequency.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/termination.Description: Defines the condition under which an acquisition is prematurely terminated (before acquiring the specified number of samples). Normally has the value 1.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/samplecount.Description: Defines the number of samples acquired of each Output PWA data set (450 MSa/s).

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/holdoff.Description: Not used. Reserved for future use.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/progress.Description: State of the Output PWA acquisition in percent.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/status.Description: Indicates whether the Output PWA is acquiring data. 0 = Output PWA is inactive, 1 = acquiring data, 2 = terminating acquisition.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/acquisitiontim.Description: Estimated time needed for recording of the specified number of samples.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/looptime.Description: Not used. Reserved for future use.

\/dev1234\/outputpwas\/0\/wave.Description: Streaming node that delivers the acquired data from the Output PWA.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/enable.Description: Enables the PWA for data acquisition. Depending on the value of the 'single' node, this may be continuous, or a one-shot acquisition.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/single.Description: If set to 1, a single data acquisition is executed when the PWA is enabled.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/oscselect.Description: Select reference oscillator for PWA signal acquisition. Has no effect if the inputinterlock node is set active.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/inputselect.Description: Select PWA input signal. Has no effect if the inputinterlock node is set active.

Options.4: "auxout0", "auxiliary_output0": Aux Output 1. Requires an installed digitizer (DIG) option.
Options.5: "auxout1", "auxiliary_output1": Aux Output 2. Requires an installed digitizer (DIG) option.
Options.6: "auxout2", "auxiliary_output2": Aux Output 3. Requires an installed digitizer (DIG) option.
Options.7: "auxout3", "auxiliary_output3": Aux Output 4. Requires an installed digitizer (DIG) option.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/mode.Description: Sets the data interpretation mode. Measurement data can be interpreted in four different modes and displayed over either phase (native), time, frequency (FFT) or harmonics of the base frequency (FFT).

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/harmonic.Description: Defines the width of the PWA acquisition window in terms of harmonics of the selected reference oscillator frequency. e.g. A value of 1 corresponds to a complete cycle of the reference frequency. A value of 2 corresponds to half of a cycle (180 deg). A value of 4 corresponds to a quarter of a cycle (90 deg).

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/shift.Description: Defines the start of the PWA range in terms of the phase of the reference frequency.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/termination.Description: Defines the condition under which an acquisition is prematurely terminated (before acquiring the specified number of samples). Normally has the value 1.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/samplecount.Description: Defines the number of samples acquired of each PWA data set (450 MSa/s).

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/holdoff.Description: Not used. Reserved for future use.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/progress.Description: State of the PWA acquisition in percent.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/status.Description: Indicates whether the PWA is acquiring data. 0 = PWA is inactive, 1 = acquiring data, 2 = terminating acquisition.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/acquisitiontime.Description: Estimated time needed for recording of the specified number of samples.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/looptime.Description: Not used. Reserved for future use.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/inputinterlock.Description: Interlock PWA and Boxcar Input settings. If on, the input signal has to be selected via the boxcar inputselect node.

\/dev1234\/inputpwas\/0\/wave.Description: Streaming node that delivers the acquired data from the PWA.

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/mode.Description: Selects the operation mode of the arithmetic unit

Options.0: "add": Add: The arithmetic unit is in add mode: two independent demodulator outputs can be added together.
Options.1: "divide": Divide: The arithmetic unit is in divide mode: two independent demodulator outputs can be divided by each other.
Options.2: "multiply": Multiply: The arithmetic unit is in multiply mode: two independent demodulator outputs can be multiplied with each other.

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/enable.Description: Enables the streaming of results to the host computer.

Options.0: "on": ON: The arithmetic unit is operative and results are streamed to the host computer.
Options.1: "off": OFF: The arithmetic unit is operative but results are not streamed to the host computer.

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/rate.Description: Defines the number of arithmetic unit result samples that are sent to the host computer per second.

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/ops\/0\/value.Description: Select the arithmetic unit input signal.

Options.0: "demod_x": Use demodulator X (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.1: "demod_y": Use demodulator Y (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.3: "demod_r": Use demodulator R (for polar AU only).
Options.4: "demod_theta": Use demodulator Θ (for polar AU only).
Options.5: "magnitude": Use the magnitude of C1 + iC2 (for polar AU only).
Options.6: "angle": Use the angle of C1 + iC2 (for polar AU only).

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/ops\/0\/demodsele.Description: Select demodulator and/or Boxcar channel number.

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/ops\/0\/coeff.Description: Select a coefficient to be applied to the selected Signal. Default: 0.

Options.1: "auxin0", "auxiliary_input0": The signal on Aux In 1 is used as coefficient.
Options.2: "auxin1", "auxiliary_input1": The signal on Aux In 2 is used as coefficient.
Options.3: "cartesian_au0": Output of Cartesian AU 1 (C1) is used as coefficient (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.4: "cartesian_au1": Output of Cartesian AU 2 (C2) is used as coefficient (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.5: "polar_au0": Output of Polar AU 1 (P1) is used as coefficient (for Polar AU only).
Options.6: "polar_au1": Output of Polar AU 2 (P2) is used as coefficient (for Polar AU only).

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/value.Description: Gives the result of the arithmetic unit at a low sampling rate (10 per second).

\/dev1234\/aucarts\/0\/sample.Description: Streaming node giving the output samples of the arithmetic unit.

\/dev1234\/aupolars\/0\/mode.Description: Selects the operation mode of the arithmetic unit.

Options.0: "add": Add: The arithmetic unit is in add mode: two independent demodulator outputs can be added together.
Options.1: "divide": Divide: The arithmetic unit is in divide mode: two independent demodulator outputs can be divided by each other.
Options.2: "multiply": Multiply: The arithmetic unit is in multiply mode: two independent demodulator outputs can be multiplied with each other.

\/dev1234\/aupolars\/0\/enable.Description: Enables the streaming of results to the host computer.

\/dev1234\/aupolars\/0\/rate.Description: Defines the number of arithmetic unit result samples that are sent to the host computer per second.

\/dev1234\/aupolars\/0\/ops\/0\/value.Description: Select the arithmetic unit input signal

Options.0: "demod_x": Use demodulator X (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.1: "demod_y": Use demodulator Y (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.3: "demod_r": Use demodulator R (for polar AU only).
Options.4: "demod_theta": Use demodulator Θ (for polar AU only).
Options.5: "magnitude": Use the magnitude of C1 + iC2 (for polar AU only).
Options.6: "angle": Use the angle of C1 + iC2 (for polar AU only).

\/dev1234\/aupolars\/0\/ops\/0\/coeff.Description: Select a coefficient to be applied to the selected Signal. Default: 0.

Options.1: "auxin0", "auxiliary_input0": The signal on Aux In 1 is used as coefficient.
Options.2: "auxin1", "auxiliary_input1": The signal on Aux In 2 is used as coefficient.
Options.3: "cartesian_au0": Output of Cartesian AU 1 (C1) is used as coefficient (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.4: "cartesian_au1": Output of Cartesian AU 2 (C2) is used as coefficient (for Cartesian AU only).
Options.5: "polar_au0": Output of Polar AU 1 (P1) is used as coefficient (for Polar AU only).
Options.6: "polar_au1": Output of Polar AU 2 (P2) is used as coefficient (for Polar AU only).

\/dev1234\/aupolars\/0\/value.Description: Gives the result of the arithmetic unit at a low sampling rate (10 per second).

\/dev1234\/aupolars\/0\/sample.Description: Streaming node giving the output samples of the arithmetic unit.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/mode.Description: Sets the operation mode of the PID module.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/input.Description: Select input source of PID controller.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/inputchannel.Description: Select input channel of PID controller.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/output.Description: Select output of the PID controller.

Options.0: "sigout", "signal_output": Feedback to the main signal output amplitudes
Options.1: "oscillator_frequency": Feedback to any of the internal oscillator frequencies
Options.2: "demod_phase": Feedback to any of the 8 demodulator phase set points
Options.3: "auxout_offset", "auxiliary_output_offset": Feedback to any of the 4 Auxiliary Output's Offset
Options.4: "sigout_offset", "signal_output_offset": Feedback to the main Signal Output offset adjustment

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/outputchannel.Description: Select the output channel of the driven output of PID controller.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/phaseunwrap.Description: Enables the phase unwrapping to track phase errors past the +/-180 degree boundary and increase PLL bandwidth.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/center.Description: Sets the center value for the PID output. After adding the Center value, the signal is clamped to Center + Lower Limit and Center + Upper Limit.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/rate.Description: PID sampling rate and update rate of PID outputs. Needs to be set substantially higher than the targeted loop filter bandwidth.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/limitupper.Description: Sets the upper limit for the PID output. After adding the Center value, the signal is clamped to Center + Lower Limit and Center + Upper Limit.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/limitlower.Description: Sets the lower limit for the PID output. After adding the Center value, the signal is clamped to Center + Lower Limit and Center + Upper Limit.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/dlimittimeconstant.Description: The cutoff of the low-pass filter for the D limitation given as time constant. When set to 0, the low-pass filter is disabled.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/stream\/rate.Description: Target Rate for PID output data sent to PC. This value defines the applied decimation for sending data to the PC. It does not affect any other place where PID data are used.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/stream\/effectiverat.Description: Current rate of the PID stream data sent to PC. Defined based on Max Rate.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/stream\/overflow.Description: Indicates the streaming fifo overflow state. 0 = OK, 1 = overflow.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/demod\/adcselect.Description: Indicates the signal source which is connected to the chosen input demodulator channel.

Options.0: "sigin0", "signal_input0": Signal Input 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.1: "sigin1", "signal_input1": Signal Input 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.2: "trigin0", "trigger_input0": Trigger Input 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.3: "trigin1", "trigger_input1": Trigger Input 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.4: "auxout0", "auxiliary_output0": Auxiliary Output 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.5: "auxout1", "auxiliary_output1": Auxiliary Output 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.6: "auxout2", "auxiliary_output2": Auxiliary Output 3 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.7: "auxout3", "auxiliary_output3": Auxiliary Output 4 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.8: "auxin0", "auxiliary_input0": Auxiliary Input 1 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.9: "auxin1", "auxiliary_input1": Auxiliary Input 2 is connected to the corresponding demodulator.
Options.10: "demod3": Oscillator Phase of Demod 4 is connected to the corresponding demodulator. This selection combined with the demodulator's ExtRef Mode can be used to phase-lock two internal oscillators.
Options.11: "demod7": Oscillator Phase of Demod 8 is connected to the corresponding demodulator. This selection combined with the demodulator's ExtRef Mode can be used to phase-lock two internal oscillators.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/demod\/order.Description: Selects the filter roll off between 6 dB/oct and 48 dB/oct of the current demodulator.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/demod\/timeconstant.Description: Defines the characteristic time constant (cut off) of the demodulator filter used as an input.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/demod\/harmonic.Description: Multiplier of the for the reference frequency of the current demodulator.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/pll\/automode.Description: This defines the type of automatic adaptation of parameters in the PID.

Options.1: "pid_coeffs": The coefficients of the PID controller are automatically set.
Options.2: "pid_coeffs_filter_low_bw": The PID coefficients, the filter bandwidth and the output limits are automatically set using a low bandwidth.
Options.3: "pid_coeffs_filter_high_bw": The PID coefficients, the filter bandwidth and the output limits are automatically set using a high bandwidth.
Options.4: "pid_all": All parameters of the PID including the center frequency are adapted.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/pll\/locked.Description: Indicates when the PID, configured as PLL, is locked.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/shift.Description: Difference between the current output value Out and the Center. Shift = P*Error + I*Int(Error, dt) + D*dError/dt

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/value.Description: Gives the current PID output value.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/keepint.Description: If enabled, the accumulated integral error is maintained upon restart of the PID. If is disabled, the integral error is set to zero when the PID is disabled.

\/dev1234\/system\/preset\/default.Description: Indicates the preset which is used as default preset at start-up of the device.

Options.0: "factory": Select factory preset as default preset.
Options.1: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 1 as default preset.
Options.2: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 2 as default preset.
Options.3: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 3 as default preset.
Options.4: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 4 as default preset.
Options.5: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 5 as default preset.
Options.6: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 6 as default preset.

\/dev1234\/system\/preset\/index.Description: Select between factory preset or presets stored in internal flash memory.

Options.1: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 1.
Options.2: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 2.
Options.3: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 3.
Options.4: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 4.
Options.5: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 5.
Options.6: Select the preset stored in internal flash memory at position 6.

\/dev1234\/system\/preset\/save.Description: Save the actual setting as preset.

\/dev1234\/system\/preset\/busy.Description: Indicates if presets are currently loaded.

\/dev1234\/system\/preset\/error.Description: Indicates if the last operation was illegal. Successful: 0, Error: 1.

\/dev1234\/system\/preset\/records\/0\/v.Description: True if a valid preset is stored.

\/dev1234\/system\/fwlog.Description: Returns log output of the firmware.

\/dev1234\/system\/nics\/0\/saveip.Description: If written, this action will program the defined static IP address to the device.

\/dev1234\/system\/nics\/0\/defaultip4.Description: IPv4 address of the device to use if static IP is enabled.

\/dev1234\/system\/nics\/0\/defaultmask.Description: IPv4 mask in case of static IP.

\/dev1234\/system\/nics\/0\/defaultgatew.Description: Default gateway configuration for the network connection.

\/dev1234\/system\/nics\/0\/static.Description: Enable this flag if the device is used in a network with fixed IP assignment without a DHCP server.

\/dev1234\/system\/nics\/0\/jumbo.Description: Stored setting for jumbo frames. Will be applied after reboot.

\/dev1234\/system\/nics\/0\/mac.Description: Current MAC address of the device network interface.

\/dev1234\/system\/jumbo.Description: Enables jumbo frames (4k) on the TCP/IP interface. This will reduce the load on the PC and is required to achieve maximal throughput. Make sure that jumbo frames (4k) are enabled on the network card as well. If one of the devices on the network is not able to work with jumbo frames, the connection will fail.

\/dev1234\/system\/stall.Description: Indicates if the network connection is stalled.

\/dev1234\/system\/identify.Description: Setting this node to 1 will cause the device to blink the power led for a few seconds.

\/dev1234\/system\/saveports.Description: Flag indicating that the TCP and UDP ports should be saved.

\/dev1234\/system\/porttcp.Description: Returns the current TCP port used for communication to the dataserver.

\/dev1234\/system\/portudp.Description: Returns the current UDP port used for communication to the dataserver.

\/dev1234\/features\/code.Description: Node providing a mechanism to write feature codes.

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/timebase.Description: Minimal time difference between two timestamps. The value is equal to 1/(maximum sampling rate).

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/freqresol.Description: The number of bits used to represent a frequency.

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/negativef.Description: Indicates whether negative frequencies are supported.

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/minfreq.Description: The minimum oscillator frequency that can be set.

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/maxfreq.Description: The maximum oscillator frequency that can be set.

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/mintimeco.Description: The minimum demodulator time constant that can be set.

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/maxtimeco.Description: The maximum demodulator time constant that can be set.

\/dev1234\/system\/properties\/freqscali.Description: The scale factor to use to convert a frequency represented as a freqresolution-bit integer to a floating point value.

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/value.Description: Voltage present on the Auxiliary Output. Auxiliary Output Value = (Signal+Preoffset)*Scale + Offset

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/limitlower.Description: Lower limit for the signal at the Auxiliary Output. A smaller value will be clipped.

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/limitupper.Description: Upper limit for the signal at the Auxiliary Output. A larger value will be clipped.

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/outputselect.Description: Select the signal source to be represented on the Auxiliary Output.

Options.-1: "manual": Select Manual as the output option.
Options.0: "demod_x": Select Demod X as the output option.
Options.1: "demod_y": Select Demod Y as the output option.
Options.2: "demod_r": Select Demod R as the output option.
Options.3: "demod_theta": Select Demod Theta as the output option.
Options.4: "awg": Select one of the AWG Outputs for auxiliary output when running the AWG in four-channel mode. The AWG option needs to be installed.
Options.5: "pid": Select PID Out as the output option.
Options.6: "boxcar": Select Boxcar as the output option.
Options.7: "au_cartesian": Select AU Cartesian as the output option.
Options.8: "au_polar": Select AU Polar as the output option.
Options.9: "pid_shift": Select PID Shift as the output option.
Options.10: "pid_error": Select PID Error as the output option.
Options.12: "pulse_counter": Select Pulse Counter as the output option.

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/demodselect.Description: Select the channel number of the selected signal source.

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/preoffset.Description: Add a pre-offset to the signal before scaling is applied. Auxiliary Output Value = (Signal+Preoffset)*Scale + Offset

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/scale.Description: Multiplication factor to scale the signal. Auxiliary Output Value = (Signal+Preoffset)*Scale + Offset

\/dev1234\/auxouts\/0\/offset.Description: Add the specified offset voltage to the signal after scaling. Auxiliary Output Value = (Signal+Preoffset)*Scale + Offset

\/dev1234\/cnts\/0\/period.Description: Set the period used for the Free Running and Gated Free Running modes. Also sets the hold-off time for the Time Tagging mode.

\/dev1234\/cnts\/0\/mode.Description: Select the run mode of the counter unit.

Options.1: "free_running": Free Running: The counter runs on a repetitive time base defined by the Period field. At the beginning of each period the counter is reset, and at the end, the accumulated number of counts is output.
Options.2: "gated_free_running": Gated Free Running: The counter runs on a repetitive time base defined by the Period field. The Gate Input signal controls when the unit counter is allowed to run. The counter as well as the timer is reset when the Gate Input signal is low. The counter will only deliver new values if the Gate Input signal is high for a time longer than the configured Period.
Options.3: "gated": Gated: The counter is controlled with the Gate Input signal. The counter is enabled at the rising edge of the Gate Input signal and disabled at the falling edge. Pulses are counted as long as the counter is enabled. The accumulated number of counts is output on the falling edge of the Gate Input signal.
Options.4: "time_tagging": Time Tagging: Every pulse is detected individually and tagged with the time of the event. The Period defines the minimum hold-off time between the tagging of two subsequent pulses. If more than one pulse occurs within the window defined by the Period, then the pulses are accumulated and output at the end of the window. The Period effectively determines the maximum rate at which pulse information can be transmitted to the host PC.

\/dev1234\/cnts\/0\/gateselect.Description: Select the signal source used for enabling the counter in the Gated Free Running and Gated modes.

\/dev1234\/cnts\/0\/operation.Description: Select the arithmetic operation (addition, subtraction) applied to the counter unit outputs. 'Other counter' refers to the grouping of the counter units: 1 with 2, and 3 with 4.

\/dev1234\/cnts\/0\/integrate.Description: Sum up counter values over time.

\/dev1234\/cnts\/0\/trigrising.Description: Performs a trigger event when the source signal crosses the trigger level from low to high. For dual edge triggering, select also the falling edge.

\/dev1234\/cnts\/0\/trigfalling.Description: Performs a trigger event when the source signal crosses the trigger level from high to low. For dual edge triggering, select also the rising edge.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/single.Description: Puts the AWG into single shot mode.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/time.Description: AWG sampling rate. The numeric values are rounded for display purposes. The exact values are equal to the base sampling rate (1.8 GHz) divided by 2^n, where n is the node value. This value is used by default and can be overridden in the Sequence program.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/ready.Description: AWG has a compiled wave form and is ready to be enabled.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/sequencer\/pc.Description: Current position in the list of sequence instructions during execution.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/sequencer\/status.Description: Status of the sequencer on the instrument. Bit 0: sequencer is running; Bit 1: reserved; Bit 2: sequencer is waiting for a) waveform playback to finish, b) prefetch to finish, or c) trigger to arrive; Bit 3: AWG has detected an error

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/sequencer\/memoryusa.Description: Size of the current sequence program relative to the device cache memory. The cache memory provides space for 1024 instructions.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/userregs\/0.Description: Integer user register value. The sequencer has reading and writing access to the user register values during run time.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/waveform\/memoryusag.Description: Amount of the used waveform data relative to the device cache memory. The cache memory provides space for 32 kSa of waveform data. Memory Usage over 100% means that waveforms must be loaded from the main memory (128 MSa per channel) during playback, which can lead to delays.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/elf\/length.Description: Length of the compiled ELF file.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/elf\/checksum.Description: Checksum of the uploaded ELF file.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/elf\/memoryusage.Description: Size of the uploaded ELF file relative to the size of the main memory.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/elf\/progress.Description: The percentage of the sequencer program already uploaded to the device.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/elf\/data.Description: Contains the data of the uploaded ELF file.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/waveform\/descriptor.Description: JSON-formatted string containing a dictionary of various properties of the current waveform: name, filename, function, channels, marker bits, length, timestamp.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/sequencer\/program.Description: Displays the source code of the current sequence program.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/sequencer\/assembly.Description: Displays the current sequence program in compiled form. Every line corresponds to one hardware instruction and requires one clock cycle (4.44 ns) for execution.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/elf\/name.Description: The name of the uploaded ELF file.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/dio\/strobe\/index.Description: Select the DIO bit to use as the STROBE signal.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/dio\/strobe\/slope.Description: Select the signal edge of the STROBE signal for use in timing alignment.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/dio\/valid\/index.Description: Select the DIO bit to use as the VALID signal to indicate a valid input is available.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/dio\/valid\/polarity.Description: Polarity of the VALID bit that indicates that a valid input is available.

Options.1: "low": Low: VALID bit must be logical zero.
Options.2: "high": High: VALID bit must be logical high.
Options.3: "both": Both: VALID bit may be logical high or zero.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/dio\/delay\/index.Description: Index of the bit on the DIO interface for which the delay should be changed.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/dio\/delay\/value.Description: Corresponding delay value to apply to the given bit of the DIO interface in units of 450 MHz clock cycles. Valid values are 0 to 3.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/waveform\/waves\/0.Description: The waveform data in the instrument's native format for the given playWave waveform index. This node will not work with subscribe as it does not push updates. For short vectors get may be used. For long vectors (causing get to time out) getAsEvent and poll can be used. The index of the waveform to be replaced can be determined using the Waveform sub-tab in the AWG tab of the LabOne User Interface.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/sweep\/awgtrigs\/0.Description: Node used by the sweeper module for fast index sweeps. When selected as sweep grid the sweeper module will switch into a fast index based scan mode. This mode can be up to 1000 times faster than conventional node sweeps. The sequencer program must support this functionality. See section 'AWG Index Sweep' of the UHF user manual for more information.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/outputs\/0\/amplitud.Description: Amplitude in units of full scale of the given AWG Output. The full scale corresponds to the Range voltage setting of the Signal Outputs.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/outputs\/0\/mode.Description: Select between plain mode, amplitude modulation, and advanced mode.

Options.0: "plain": Plain: AWG Output goes directly to Signal Output.
Options.1: "modulation": Modulation: AWG Output 1 (2) is multiplied with oscillator signal of demodulator 4 (8).
Options.2: "advanced": Advanced: Output of AWG channel 1 (2) modulates demodulators 1-4 (5-8) with independent envelopes.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/outputs\/0\/enables\.Description: Enables the driving of the given AWG output channel.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/triggers\/0\/hystere.Description: Defines the voltage the source signal must deviate from the trigger level before the trigger is rearmed again. Set to 0 to turn it off. The sign is defined by the Edge setting.
Hysteresis relative to the adjusted full scale signal input range. A hysteresis value larger than 100% is allowed.
Selects the mode to define the hysteresis strength. The relative mode will work best over the full input range as long as the analog input signal does not suffer from excessive noise.

Options.1: "relative": Selects a hysteresis relative to the adjusted full scale signal input range (%).

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/triggers\/0\/channel.Description: Selects the signal source for the analogue trigger.

Options.4: "auxout0", "auxiliary_output0": Aux Output 1. Requires an installed digitizer (DIG) option.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/triggers\/0\/force.Description: Allows to manually force a trigger.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/triggers\/0\/state.Description: State of the Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/triggers\/0\/gate\/e.Description: If enabled the trigger will be gated by the trigger gating input signal.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/triggers\/0\/gate\/i.Description: Select the signal source used for trigger gating if gating is enabled.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/triggers\/0\/slope.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the trigger. The trigger will be level sensitive when the Level option is selected.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/auxtriggers\/0\/chan.Description: Selects the digital trigger source signal.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/auxtriggers\/0\/stat.Description: State of the Auxiliary Trigger: No trigger detected/trigger detected.

\/dev1234\/awgs\/0\/auxtriggers\/0\/slop.Description: Select the signal edge that should activate the trigger. The trigger will be level sensitive when the Level option is selected.

\/dev1234\/system\/fwrevision.Description: Revision of the device-internal controller software.

\/dev1234\/status\/fifolevel.Description: USB FIFO level: Indicates the USB FIFO fill level inside the device. When 100%, data is lost

\/dev1234\/clockbase.Description: Returns the internal clock frequency of the device.

\/dev1234\/system\/owner.Description: Returns the current owner of the device (IP).

\/dev1234\/system\/activeinterface.Description: Currently active interface of the device.

\/dev1234\/system\/interfacespeed.Description: Speed of the currently active interface (USB only).

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/bytesreceiv.Description: Number of bytes received on the command stream from the device since session start.

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/bytessent.Description: Number of bytes sent on the command stream from the device since session start.

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/packetsrece.Description: Number of packets received on the command stream from the device since session start.

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/packetssent.Description: Number of packets sent on the command stream to the device since session start.

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/packetslost.Description: Number of command packets lost since device start. Command packets contain device settings that are sent to and received from the device.

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/bandwidth.Description: Command streaming bandwidth usage on the physical network connection between device and data server.

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/processing.Description: Number of buffers being processed for command packets. Small values indicate proper performance. For a TCP/IP interface, command packets are sent using the TCP protocol.

\/dev1234\/stats\/cmdstream\/pending.Description: Number of buffers ready for receiving command packets from the device.

\/dev1234\/stats\/datastream\/bytesrecei.Description: Number of bytes received on the data stream from the device since session start.

\/dev1234\/stats\/datastream\/packetsrec.Description: Number of packets received on the data stream from the device since session start.

\/dev1234\/stats\/datastream\/packetslos.Description: Number of data packets lost since device start. Data packets contain measurement data.

\/dev1234\/stats\/datastream\/bandwidth.Description: Data streaming bandwidth usage on the physical network connection between device and data server.

\/dev1234\/stats\/datastream\/processing.Description: Number of buffers being processed for data packets. Small values indicate proper performance. For a TCP/IP interface, data packets are sent using the UDP protocol.

\/dev1234\/stats\/datastream\/pending.Description: Number of buffers ready for receiving data packets from the device.

\/dev1234\/status\/flags\/packetlosstcp.Description: Flag indicating if tcp packages have been lost.

\/dev1234\/status\/flags\/packetlossudp.Description: Flag indicating if udp packages have been lost.

\/dev1234\/system\/awg\/channelgrouping.Description: Sets the channel grouping mode of the device.

Options.0: "groups_of_2": Use the outputs in groups of 2. One sequencer program controls 2 outputs (use /dev..../awgs/0..4/).
Options.1: "groups_of_4": Use the outputs in groups of 4. One sequencer program controls 4 outputs (use /dev..../awgs/0/ and /dev..../awgs/2/)
Options.2: "groups_of_8": Use the outputs in groups of 8. One sequencer program controls 8 outputs (use /dev..../awgs/0/). Requires 8 channel device.

\/dev1234\/demods\/0\/sample.Description: Contains streamed demodulator samples with sample interval defined by the demodulator data rate.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/stream\/value.Description: Gives the current PID output value.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/stream\/error.Description: PID Error = Set point - PID Input.

\/dev1234\/pids\/0\/stream\/shift.Description: Gives the difference between the current output value and the center value. Shift = P*Error + I*Int(Error, dt) + D*dError/dt

\/dev1234\/system\/update.Description: Requests update of the device firmware and bitstream from the dataserver.
